result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander E Schultz

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Alexander E Schultz in court with Co-Guardian Roberta Hart Schultz.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty appeared by video for Alexander E Schultz.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
There are no victims. 

Defense has been in contact with charging DA, is hoping to come to resolution, and requests another date. State does not object. 
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on November 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:10 AM Defendant Alexander E Schultz in court.  Attorney Alex Huppertz for attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Alexander E Schultz. Defendant's mother also appears in court. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is in the process of getting discovery, and requests a date in 45-60 days. 
State indicates that discovery was given to Atty Powers in July. State will forward offer to Defense. 
Court sets hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:34 AM Defendant Alexander E Schultz in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant's Co-Guardian Roberta Hardt Schultz in court.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Mark Powers
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Alexander E Schultz in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.   
Court to Address:  Competency Evaluation - Filed by John Pankiewicz - Findings are the defendant is competency to proceed.

Both the State and Defense have received a copy of the competency evaluation.
Neither the State or Defense are contesting the finding or requesting a second evaluation.
Court finds the defendant is currently competent to proceed.

Defense waives time limits for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed by Dr. John Pankiewicz, M.D.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorney received and filed.
Attorney Mark Powers

Adjustment Number: 22A 020391,
Payable Number: 465629,
Amount: $20.00
Review hearing on June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Requesting the Review of Competency currently scheduled for 06/06/22 @ 1:30 pm. be scheduled.

05/04/22 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Review Hearing to be rescheduled.ep.
Review hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
For Competency Exam

TO BE CO-SIGN BY EITHER WITNESS A OR B LIST IN THE VICTIM ID KEY.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.   Defendant to have no contact with Fletcher Arms listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:00 AM Defendant Alexander E Schultz in court with SPD Intern, Taylor Olson, for attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Ostrowski is appointed.
THE COURT ORDERS A COMPETENCY REVIEW PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2) SUA SPONTE.  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
